item.title: Tarmac around manhole cover dislodged leaving large hole, 4th December
item.description:
Tarmac around manhole cover dislodged leaving large hole on one side and lump of tarmac in road. Poses risks if unsighted to motorcyclists and cyclists in particular
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kentish Way, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous dumping of food bags, 4th December
item.description:
Someone in the local area is either trying to feed the foxes, or poison them. These bags have been appearing for a couple of months. Foxes and rodents are feeding from them, scattering them around the local area. The plastic is a choking hazard, and I’m not sure what the bags contain. Dogs try to eat the contents, which could be harmful - the plastic bags are definitely harmful to dogs and wildlife. It’s also causing a daily littering issue

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Woolwich Road, Upper Belvedere, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large dog fouling outside my gate again!, 4th December
item.description:
This is second report of large dog fouling outside my gate this week. It’s from a large dog again and it has been walked in so it is now all over the pavement. What can we do about this dog that has a favourite spot to go outside my gate!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ickburgh Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subway light not working, 4th December
item.description:
I am writing to report a serious safety concern regarding the subway under Westminster Arch leading to Grosvenor Place. The lighting in the subway is currently not working, leaving the area in complete darkness. Additionally, there are rough sleepers occupying the subway, which makes the passage unsafe for pedestrians. This subway is the only available safe crossing point in the area, and its current condition poses a significant risk to public safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Subway, Belgravia, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still broken glass from recent vehicle file on the pavement!, 4th December
item.description:
This is the third time I am requesting this. I am unsure who exactly is your contractor and why they are seemingly unable to follow basic descriptions or photos but the broken glass from this fire is still on the pavement. The location marker is accurate, the description is accurate (the house the debris is located is clearly under construction). I am perplexed how your contractor cannot locate it. The photos I've provided are from this morning (04/12/25)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous footpath., 4th December
item.description:
There are 3/4 cracked, broken and rocky paving slabs outside 19 Lovel Avenue, DA16 3JQ. An elderly lady stumbled on one of them, when they were covered with fallen leaves. They are getting worse and need replacing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lovel Avenue, East Wickham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Compost bin rubbish across pavement, 4th December
item.description:
Someone’s compost bin got tipped over by foxes last week and the rubbish has been strewn across pavement since then. Street cleaning should have been by now so please can they attend as soon as possible. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Durning Road, West Norwood, Greater London

item.title: Road access completely blocked to residents of 1 - 6 Highbury Place N5 due to Lime bikes, 4th December
item.description:
Road access completely blocked to residents of 1 - 6 Highbury Place N5 due to Lime bikes. Lime are only allowed 2 parking bays in this location - they are consistently occupying 6 bays. Lime now say they are doing this with the council's permission!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Highbury Place, Highbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The white van has been parked outside our fence in Thornet Wood Road for the past two weeks with no signs of any attention indicating to us it has been dumped., 4th December
item.description:
This van overlooks our fencing. I feel somewhat intimidated by having this van overlooking our fence and it has not moved for a week There is no other houses opposite i.e. no reason for it to be parked where it is parked. Please do not pass on my details as the complainant as I do not want to provoke anyone but would like the van moved away for our peace of mind.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thornet Wood Road, Bickley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish everywhere on boleyn road, 4th December
item.description:
The street is disgusting every morningX rubbish out on the street for days or weeks at the time. Shame on you for letting this street deteriorate to the extend that it has whilst we pay thousands of pounds in council tax. Despicable services

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Boleyn Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
